column4: hi guys - i am having trouble listening to rm files on ubuntu
getting stream errors etc
what do i have to do to be able to listen to rm files in ubuntu pls?
any help will be appreciated thanks
do you have real player installed?
i get GStreamer encountered a general stream error. -- that's on totem. i do have real player installed too
try to uninstall gstreamer
real player doesnt even open it - it just hangs
even though all other files work on it?
there r loads of gstreamers installed
i'm trygin to find another way.
the error message comes with a code of some sort.
it just says An error occurred. GStreamer encountered a general stream error.
i have tried removing real player also - same error - btw what's the 'correct' way of installing real player on ubuntu?
yeah that's what i did - but it seems very small compared to real's binary
How many MB?
well the official one on their site is 7.5mb
- this one seems much smaller
what's helix player?
It's a media player
did you installed helix dna too?
i installed the real player from real's site and it works - it installed it in /opt - but isn't there a proper way of doing this with a deb file?
ok now what?! :)
try this http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1022048&highlight=realplayer
